definition: butcher
surname Tu
to slaughter (animals for food)/to massacre
a household/door/family

sentences.english: The farrier, a small man with a sharp face, always enjoyed disagreeing with the butcher.
sentences.chinese: 長着尖臉的小個子馬掌匠最愛和屠戶過不去。

sentences.english: So Ben butchers in the past rely on the straw heap below, pick up the butcher's knife lay down their burden.
sentences.chinese: 屠戶於是奔過去倚靠在柴草堆下，放下擔子拿起屠刀。

sentences.english: When the donkey became old, they sold it off to a butcher for profit.
sentences.chinese: 待驢老了，幹不動活時，他們就把它賣給屠戶殺了。

sentences.english: The butchers also wore cloth apron but they were mostly blue in color.
sentences.chinese: 屠戶也佩帶了布料圍裙，但他們是主要藍色的。

sentences.english: Butchers very distress, I am afraid to be a wolf before and after the attack.
sentences.chinese: 屠戶很急很怕，恐怕前後一起受到狼的攻擊。

sentences.english: People have the habit of inquiring—if they are no more than butchers and bakers .
sentences.chinese: 人們都有好問的習慣，即使是屠戶和餅師也所不能免。

definition: to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
a fine line/a fine distinction
Homer's Iliad
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
lingering fear
to wail at a funeral/formal wailing while offering sacrifice to the departed
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
to help with farm work/casual laborer
to perform conjuring tricks/to conjure/to juggle
red in the face/extremely angry
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
(idiom) reluctant to speak about it/tight-lipped
lit. the cicada sheds its carapace (idiom); fig. to vanish leaving an empty shell/a crafty escape plan
to have no news whatever
